reviewText: I love the dvd. Daffy Duck and Porky Pig are my 1# favorite Looney Tune characters. The Dvd also has bonus features such as 3 " Behind the Tunes" documentary's.
this is a awesome collection of tmnt episodes. it is fun and enjoyable to watch. if you have not seen this dvd then i recommend you do

I'M CRAZY FOR DAFFY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This has some really good toons on it!  # 1  Daffy Duck and the dinosaur  # 2 Porky's railroad # 3  Jungle Jitters  # 4  Gold rush daze ( wrongly listed as Early bird gets worm on back cover ).  But heck, I still love this tape. AND YOU DO TO!!!!!!!!!!!!  - JET

Daffy Duck is by far my favorite Looney Tunes character and this tape contains:

1.  Daffy's sothern exposure

2.  Fox pop

3.  Sports chumpions

4. A coy decoy

These are some of my favorite Looney Tunes cartoons ever made!

Highlight of this meager program (4 animations) is a war-related short now considered politically incorrect. Also here is a Daffy boxing toon featuring the only appearance of "Larramore," an unfamiliar rabbit that soon transitioned into a major star and an animation influenced by Warner's success with THE ADVENTURES OF ROBIN HOOD (1938). PROGRAM-- DAFFY - THE COMMANDO (1943) - Hilarious WWII propaganda piece has Daffy Duck taking on the entire Third Reich. ROBIN HOOD MAKES GOOD (1939) - Smallest squirrel rescues his friends from a hungry fox. TO DUCK... OR NOT TO DUCK (1943) - Daffy and Elmer battle it out in the ring as Fudd's dog Larramore watches. PREST-O CHANGE-O (1939) - Original version of Bugs Bunny (in his second cartoon) has a different voice and is unrecognizable.
